8a8856a3-a757-4375-8bd9-1f54652674f1.description: FourBlock's Career Readiness Program is a semester-long course designed to equip veterans and transitioning service members with the tools needed to build the professional relationships necessary to transition to meaningful civilian careers. Veterans meet weekly with company representatives to explore new industries and careers that may align with their interests, skills, experiences, and values, while taking time to self-reflect and think critically about what is important to them.
8a8856a3-a757-4375-8bd9-1f54652674f1.name: Veteran Career Readiness Program Alumni

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners complete 35+ hours of coursework via our comprehensive career readiness curriculum. Hours are inclusive of weekly in-person or virtual cohort classes/sessions with company representatives, one-on-one meetings with course instructors and coaches, and independent research and goal setting. 80% attendance at weekly sessions is required.

Complete the following course deliverables: 1) Develop elevator pitch; adapt for various situations; 2) Produce a military-to-civilian transition story (Tell me about yourself); 3) Develop master and targeted resumes 4) Refine LinkedIn profile; 5) Complete mock interview and receive detailed feedback 6) Develop target list of companies for relationship-based career strategy.
Complete a pre- and post-program assessment to measure learning and growth.

5960e3e8-0d25-4259-a148-54d4a30e5502.description: In partnership with Prepare to Launch U, FourBlock's Military Spouse Program is a 10-week course designed to equip military spouses with all of the instruction, inspiration, practical tools, and resources they need to inform and prepare themselves for today's workplace. The program features live video coaching, flexible online learning modules, and a small cohort of other military spouses, all of whom are ready to begin, restart, or pivot to new careers.
5960e3e8-0d25-4259-a148-54d4a30e5502.name: FourBlock/PTLU Military Spouse Career Readiness Program Alumni

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners complete a minimum of 60 hours of coursework inclusive of weekly self-paced video instruction, supplemental "live" virtual instruction, real-time virtual coaching calls with course instructors and cohort, independent research, and career goal setting. Outcomes include a polished resume, LinkedIn profile, and all the skills, strategy, and confidence needed to network effectively, interview successfully, and negotiate smartly.
Complete a pre- and post-program assessment to measure personal learning and growth.

25c3a7f2-e364-47fa-8880-b68dbae748c0.description: The Veteran CRP Skills Coach is a front-line, direct-service volunteer who supports one to three veterans as they complete the CRP in different locations around the country. FourBlock’s Career Readiness Program (CRP) is a semester-long course that helps veterans prepare to effectively transition to meaningful careers in the civilian workforce.
25c3a7f2-e364-47fa-8880-b68dbae748c0.name: Certified FourBlock Career Readiness Program Skills Coach

badge_template_activities.title: Attend student orientation and facilitate breakout room discussions, as needed, using prepared guiding questions.

Provide individual feedback to students on a weekly or bi-weekly basis (in-person, by phone, video call, etc.), based on course actions and deliverables: 1) Create and deliver a concise and effective elevator pitch; 2) Tell a story that answers the question, “Tell me about yourself;" 3) Develop a targeted resume; 4) Update and improve a LinkedIn profile; 5) Prepare for one mock interview; 6) Develop a target list of companies that demonstrates a strategy for relationship-based career growth.

Work directly with course Instructor to communicate student progress and identify those who need additional support; Keep track of student progress over the course of the semester and submit a completed progress checklist at the end of the course.
Passion for assisting transitioning service members and veterans begin a meaningful career in the civilian workforce.

COMMITMENT: Approximately 5-8 direct service hours, per student, over the program semester. This includes time interacting with students, corresponding with FourBlock instructors on student performance and progress, reviewing course curriculum, and participating in any ancillary training. Attend a minimum of 3 classes over the course of the semester.

d55a7dc2-593f-4ca6-bfdc-0f488555528c.description: FourBlock Career Readiness Instructors work directly with the FourBlock Regional Director, Career Readiness Coaches, and local employer partners to effectively deliver the FourBlock Veteran Career Readiness Program curriculum to a cohort of transitioning service members and veterans seeking new careers. Career Readiness Instructors are, in many ways, similar to an adjunct professor at a local college or university.
d55a7dc2-593f-4ca6-bfdc-0f488555528c.name: Certified FourBlock Career Readiness Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Experience includes: 1) A minimum three years of civilian work experience; 2) Bachelor’s degree required, master's degree preferred; 3) Exceptional writing and presentation skills; 4) Prior teaching or corporate training experience preferred.
Commitment: One school year (typically fall & spring semesters); five to seven hours per week over the course of a 10-12 week program.

Expectations: Facilitate a two-hour class (+networking time) each week; conduct preparatory work inclusive of lesson plans, logistics coordination, program supervision, and time spent providing all students with quality feedback. Career Readiness Instructors are expected to take time prior to the course start date to become familiar with all course materials and expectations.
